action: I want to view a dashboard that visualizes business status, KPIs, and progress indicators in real-time
reason: To make rapid data-driven decisions and perform business improvements based on numerical evidence
acceptance_criteria: The dashboard is only viewable by authenticated users.
Displayed data is restricted according to the user's role.
Multiple KPI widgets can be placed on the dashboard.
Widgets can be rearranged via drag-and-drop operations.
The display period (Daily / Weekly / Monthly / Custom) can be specified.
An error occurs if the period is not specified.
Data is automatically aggregated from the database.
Aggregation processing guarantees transaction consistency.
Logically deleted data is excluded from aggregation.
Real-time updates are implemented via WebSocket or polling.
Update retrieval via invalid tokens is rejected.
A caching mechanism reduces database load.
The cache is automatically invalidated upon data updates.
Graph display formats (Bar / Line / Pie) can be toggled.
Data can be exported in CSV/Excel formats.
Formula injection countermeasures are implemented for CSV output.
Dashboard settings are saved on a per-user basis.
A history of configuration changes is maintained.
SQL injection countermeasures are implemented.
Displayed data is protected against XSS.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
Internal system information is not included in the response.
Error messages are displayed upon data retrieval failure.
Error details are saved only in internal logs.
Dashboard viewing logs are stored.
Logs include user_id, timestamp, and dashboard_id.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Target response time is within 500ms (excluding aggregation processing).
KPIs subject to SLA monitoring can be configured.
SLA violations are integrated with alert notifications.
Dashboard templates are editable from the management screen.
Template change history is maintained.
Communication is conducted via HTTPS.
Data is processed in UTF-8.
The design allows for scale-out support during increased concurrent access.
